provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from the CEO or senior officer confirming compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must report to the FTC any Covered Incidents affecting 500 or more consumers within 10 days of notifying government entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain signed acknowledgments of the Order from all relevant personnel and entities for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports and timely notices of any structural changes or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain records for 20 years documenting compliance with all provisions of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has authority to monitor compliance through requests for reports, depositions, document production, and interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Order supersedes the 2010 Decision and Order previously issued against Rite Aid.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: One year after issuance, and each year thereafter, Respondents must provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior executive confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected/undisclosed material noncompliance, and a description of all qualifying Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a detailed report to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, officers, directors, subsidiaries, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports, compliance notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, and bankruptcy filing notices within 14 days of filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance through requests for reports and records, depositions, discovery, direct communications, interviews, and undercover methods, with Respondents obligated to respond within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes and replaces the Commission's 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with specified exceptions for individual provisions, non-defendant respondents, and dismissed complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer in connection with covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or software application that results in gathering information from or about consumers, including location information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from using any information or data obtained in a manner that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III when collecting or attempting to collect debts pursuant to covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver copies of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers with responsibilities related to the order's subject matter and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission within 60 days and as otherwise required, and must notify the Commission 30 days prior to any corporate changes affecting compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or 20 years from the most recent date of a federal court complaint alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any monitoring technology to gather information from any computer rented to a consumer in covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or software application that results in gathering information from or about a consumer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent must not use information obtained in violation of Parts I, II, or III when collecting debts pursuant to covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to all current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission within 60 days of service and notify the Commission of corporate changes at least 30 days in advance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any monitoring technology to gather information from computers rented to consumers in covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making any false representation in any notice, prompt screen, or software application that results in gathering information from or about a consumer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from using any information obtained in violation of Parts I, II, and III when collecting or attempting to collect a debt pursuant to a covered rent-to-own transaction.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with responsibilities related to the subject matter, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission and notify the Commission of corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents related to complaints, compliance, and acknowledgments of receipt of this order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained from using any monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer in connection with any covered rent-to-own transaction.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained from making any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or software application that results in gathering information from or about a consumer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained from using information obtained in violation of Parts I, II, and III in connection with collecting or attempting to collect a debt or property pursuant to a covered rent-to-own transaction.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers with responsibilities related to the subject matter, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission within sixty days after service of the order and at other times as required, and must notify the Commission of corporate changes affecting compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years after the last date of any act or practice covered by Parts I-VI all documents relating to complaints, compliance, contradictions, or acknowledgments of receipt of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: This Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the Order, whichever comes later, subject to specific conditions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Ban on Disclosure of Health Information for Advertising Purposes
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from disclosing Health Information to Third Parties for Advertising Purposes, including advertising, marketing, or promoting products or services through third-party platforms.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Requirement to Obtain Affirmative Express Consent for Any Other Disclosure of Health Information
provisions.summary: Before disclosing any consumer's Health Information to any Third Party, Defendant must first obtain the relevant consumer's Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting its data collection, use, and disclosure practices, including misrepresentations about HIPAA compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Data Deletion
provisions.summary: Defendant must identify all Third Parties that received Covered Information without consent, notify them, instruct them to delete that information, and cease further disclosures to them pending confirmation of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Notice to Covered Users
provisions.summary: Defendant must email all Covered Users a court-mandated notice (Exhibit A) within 14 days of the effective date of the Order, without including any other materials with the notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Cooperation with Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, disclosing all Covered Information in its custody, and not misrepresenting any material facts to the Assessor.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide annual certifications from a senior corporate manager to the Commission for 10 years, attesting to compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a report to the Commission within 30 days of discovering a Covered Incident, including the date, description, number of consumers affected, remediation steps taken, and any notices sent to consumers or government entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty and Suspension
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $2,500,000 is entered against Defendant but suspended based on Defendant's financial representations; the suspension will be lifted if Defendant is found to have made material misstatements in its financial disclosures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all right and title to assets transferred under the Order; the Complaint's allegations may be taken as true in subsequent litigation; the civil penalty is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy; and Defendant's Taxpayer Identification Numbers may be used for collection purposes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must acknowledge receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies to all relevant personnel within 7 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from all recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit an annual compliance report one year after entry, provide timely notices of any changes in contact information or corporate structure for 10 years, notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and submit all filings under penalty of perjury via the designated email address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through requests for reports and documents, depositions, direct communications with Defendant's personnel, undercover investigations, and use of compulsory process.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018 (OARFPA), 15 U.S.C. § 45d

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from their CEO (or designated senior officer) confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing all Covered Incidents affecting 100 or more consumers during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a report to the Commission detailing the incident's date, facts, affected information types, number of affected consumers, remediation actions taken, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit their own acknowledgment of receipt within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to current and future principals, officers, relevant employees, subsidiaries, and agents for 20 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit an initial sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices within 14 days of structural or contact changes or bankruptcy filings, and submit all required documents to the Commission via specified channels.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting additional reports, conducting depositions, obtaining records, communicating directly with Respondents, interviewing affiliated individuals, and using all other lawful means including undercover operations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes the Commission's prior 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov and will terminate 20 years from the date of issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a federal court complaint alleging a violation of this Order, whichever is later, with specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent how they review data suppliers' consent frameworks, how they collect or handle Covered Information, or the extent to which their Location Data is deidentified.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibitions on the Use, Sale, or Disclosure of Sensitive Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondents must not sell, license, transfer, share, disclose, or use in any products or services Sensitive Location Data associated with identified Sensitive Locations, subject to limited exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Sensitive Location Data Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a Sensitive Location Data Program within 90 days that develops a comprehensive list of Sensitive Locations and prevents the use, sale, or disclosure of Sensitive Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Other Location Data Obligations
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish policies and technical measures within 90 days to prevent association of Location Data with LGBTQ+ service locations, political demonstration locations, or use to identify individual home addresses, and must impose equivalent contractual restrictions on recipients.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Third-Party Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a report to the FTC within 30 days of determining that a Third-Party Incident has occurred, including details about the incident's nature, scope, affected consumers, and remediation steps.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Supplier Assessment Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must implement a Supplier Assessment Program within 90 days to ensure consumers have consented to the collection and use of their precise location data, including documented assessments of all data suppliers and cessation of use of non-consented data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Disclosures to Consumers
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide consumers with a clear and conspicuous means to request the identity of entities to whom their Location Data was sold or disclosed, or alternatively provide a mechanism for consumers to request deletion of their Location Data from all recipients' databases.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Withdrawing Consent
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide consumers with a simple, easily-located means to withdraw consent to Respondents' use or disclosure of their Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Obligations When Consent is Withdrawn
provisions.summary: Respondents must cease using and disclosing all Location Data associated with a specific device within 15 days after receiving notice that a consumer has withdrawn their consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Location Data Deletion Requests
provisions.summary: Respondents must implement a simple, clear means for consumers to request deletion of their Location Data and must complete such deletions within 30 days of receiving a request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Respondents must document, publish, and adhere to a publicly available retention schedule for Covered Information within 60 days, submit it to the Commission, and update the schedule before collecting new types of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all Historic Location Data within 60 days and all Data Products within 90 days, notify customers who received Historic Location Data, and submit confirmations to the Commission, unless they can document valid consumer consent or deidentify the data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit sworn acknowledgments of receipt of the Order to the FTC within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, relevant employees, and agents within 10 days (and to new personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, notify the Commission within 14 days of changes to contact information or corporate structure, notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing, and submit all required filings electronically to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain for 5 years specified records including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, law enforcement communications, representations about data practices, and records documenting compliance with key Order provisions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requiring additional reports and records within 14 days of request, conducting direct communications and interviews with Respondents' personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover investigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website as a final order and terminates 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act
